pros: Work-life balance Competent boss Good benefits Passion for hospice Overall work culture Good support
cons: Lower than average pay A lot of changing policies Upper mgmt can be wishy washy

review_title: Truly displays the heart of what hospice should be
job_title: Marketing Representative in El Campo, TX
pros: Amazing staff that truly works together as a team.

cons: In the process of changing drastically. Get called off often. Processes are confused.

pros: The amount of charity and the fact they giveback.
cons: How employees are not taken care of.

pros: Accepts charity patients who do not have insurance (case-by-case)
cons: Very secretive and disorganized about program development. No input from employees, very top-down organization.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Wharton, TX
pros: Team works well with each other, very professional
cons: Benefits could be better and pay is low

job_title: LVN Charge Nurse in Houston, TX
pros: Good pay and close small nursing group
Benefits are ok. but on the expensive side
cons: If you're an LVN, to syart your pay is that of a GN and there is a 3 to 4 page des ription of job duties. That is not to include the ones added on as "other duties". They also expect you to do home visits in addition to all the admin paperwork and in office duties. They do not provide bilingual pay and although they have a translation line expect you to do so at the drop of a dime. New manager has NO people or managerial experience or skills. Office environment is an open concept and no respect for space or privacy in order to complete your work. LVN's are definitely over worked here and pay does not suffice. Management is immature and clueless.

pros: Wonderful place to work.   You get to learn all aspects of accounting and just one function.   What Houston Hospice does for patient care and families is amazing!
cons: When patient census is down there is no other option but to let employees go.  It makes more work on the employees who get to stay but it is a non-profit organization. Long term employees get chosen for the lay off because of their salary not their knowledge or commitment.

pros: Excellent, state-of-the art facility and staff = very good reputation. This is a place I am proud to work for. The patients and families are first priority and the clinical staff are angels. Many non-profits use that as an excuse to under-pay. The pay here is competitive. Co-workers are friendly and helpful.
cons: Would be nice if there were more resources for enrichment/education - conferences, team building, etc. Hopefully, when market isn't saturated with for-profits, these resources will be available.

pros: Feeling proud to work for an organization that takes such good care of terminal patients and being a part of it.
cons: Some poor management, some office politics, some retaliation.

pros: Great place to work I would go back and work but in trying to further my education
cons: This is no cons that I no of
